meanings.definition: Make a similar or identical version of something.
meanings.sent1: She was copying her friend's drawing to practice her own skills.
meanings.sent2: The student was copying the answers from the textbook onto his paper.
meanings.sent3: The monkey started copying the zookeeper's movements, much to the visitors' amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her style of painting was so unique that other artists tried copying it but couldn't capture the same essence.
meanings.sent5: The detective caught the criminal red-handed, in the act of copying the confidential files.

meanings.sent1: He was copying the ancient manuscript word for word to preserve its content.
meanings.sent2: The printer was copying the document with precision to ensure no errors.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was copying the sounds of the household items, much to the family's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The artist was copying the intricate details of the sculpture with meticulous care.
meanings.sent5: The machine was copying the pattern onto the fabric flawlessly, creating identical pieces.

meanings.sent1: The child was copying his favorite superhero's actions while playing outside.
meanings.sent2: The comedian was copying the mannerisms of famous personalities for his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent3: The robot started copying the dance moves of the dancers on stage, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her little sister was copying her every move, like a mirror reflecting her actions.
meanings.sent5: The actor was copying the accent of the character he was portraying, adding authenticity to his performance.
